JUDGES: Ján Šikuta;Johannes Silvis;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are Mr PERSON ( “ the first applicant ” ) , ORG ( “ the second applicant ” ) and ORG ( “ the third applicant ” ) .

CARDINAL . The first applicant is a medical doctor and a NORP national who was born in DATE , and is presently serving a prison sentence in the ORG . The second and third applicants are limited liability companies based in GPE . They were both co - owned by the first applicant .

CARDINAL . The applicants are represented before the ORG by Mr M. Zindović , Mr Ž. Lazović , PERSON and PERSON , all lawyers practising in GPE . ORG ( the Government ” ) were initially represented by their former Agent , Mr PERSON , and subsequently by their current Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the cases , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was arrested on charges primarily related to the production and trafficking of narcotics ( amphetamines ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant and numerous others were indicted by ORG for various drugs - related felonies alleged to have been committed in an organised crime context . The first applicant was described as being the head of this criminal enterprise .

CARDINAL . The second and third applicants were never indicted , as the domestic legislation at that time did not provide for the possibility to bring criminal charges against legal entities . They were , however , mentioned as vehicles used by the first applicant and others to carry out their criminal endeavours , as well as companies in which criminal proceeds had been invested .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the GPE ORG : ( a ) found the first applicant guilty and sentenced him to a total of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment for the narcotics - related charges , as well as the charge of tax evasion ; ( b ) ordered the confiscation of all substances containing amphetamine found in the first applicant ’s possession ; ( c ) ordered the confiscation of the CARDINAL United Sates Dollars ( “ NORP ” ) and CARDINAL ( “ EUR ” ) found in the first applicant ’s flat ; ( d ) ordered the confiscation of the MONEY ( “ CHF ” ) deposited in the first applicant ’s bank account in GPE ; ( e ) ordered the first applicant to pay , for the restitution of the “ remainder of his criminally gained assets ” , the sum of USD MONEY ; and ( f ) ordered the confiscation of a building owned by the second applicant , as well as the confiscation of all of the second and third applicants’ production facilities , laboratory equipment and chemical substances found on their LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first applicant ’s conviction as regards the narcotics - related charges , and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . ORG further quashed the first applicant ’s conviction regarding tax evasion , and excluded the second applicant ’s building from the confiscation ordered at first instance , noting that following the removal of the confiscated production facilities and illegal substances the building itself posed no danger to the public .
CARDINAL . The applicants did not receive ORG decision DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicants filed an appeal on points of law ( zahtev za ispitivanje zakonitosti pravosnažne presude ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting in a differently composed panel compared to the one which had considered the applicants’ case on appeal , rejected the first applicant ’s appeal on points of law as unfounded . As regards the second and third applicants’ pleadings , they were rejected as inadmissible since an appeal on points of law could only be filed by the defendants and their counsel . On DATE the judgment was issued in writing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG formally filed a request with the competent NORP authorities , relying on its judgment of DATE , seeking confiscation of the funds deposited on the first applicant ’s bank account in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected this request as unfounded , stating , inter alia , that it could not conclude that the assets in question were indeed of a criminal origin . In particular , there was no evidence that the first applicant had made any deposits during the period when he was alleged to have committed the crimes in question . By DATE , this rejection became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was informed by the NORP authorities that he could freely access and make use of his funds on the bank account in question .
